questions.text: Angular is built on the latest standards of the web platform. Targeting such a wide range of browsers is challenging because they do not support all features of modern browsers. You compensate by loading polyfill scripts ('polyfills') on the host web page (index.html) that implement missing features in JavaScript.
For every Angular component we write, we may define not only an HTML template, but also the CSS styles that go with that template. But we cannot write media queries here.
Component styles have a few special selectors from the world of shadow DOM style scoping. These selectors are
Select correct syntax
What's new in Angular 2?

answers.text: The new Angular version will be focused on the development of mobile apps
Various modules will be removed from Angular’s core, resulting in better performance.
Angular 2 will target ES6 and 'evergreen' modern browsers (those automatically updated to the latest version)

questions.text: An Angular module is a class decorated with @NgModule metadata. The metadata:

answers.text: Declare which components, directives and pipes belong to the module.
Make some of those classes public so that other component templates can use them.
Provide services at the application level that any application component can use.

answers.text: ngDoCheck() Called during every change detection run
ngOnInit() Initialize the directive/component after Angular first displays the data-bound properties and sets the directive/component's input properties
ngOnDestroy() Called after Angular destroys the directive/component

questions.text: To implement routing, we’ll need the Angular Router. What is Angular Router?

answers.text: The Angular router is an external, optional Angular NgModule called RouterModule
Combination of multiple provided services (RouterModule), multiple directives (RouterOutlet, RouterLink, RouterLinkActive), and a configuration (Routes)

questions.text: What is Type Script?

answers.text: A language which compile code into JavaScript
It's not like other script language like Coffee script , Jquery etc. which run into client side

CORS is a mechanism that allows restricted resources on a web page to be requested from another domain outside the domain from which the resource originated.
NPM is command line utility to install Node.js packages, do version management and dependency management of Node.js packages.
